title: IDS/IPS system basics
description:
How to install and configure Suricata IDS. Writing your first rule.
Configuring IPS mode with drop rules.

objectives.title: Introduction
objectives.description: What this lab is about. What the student needs to do.

steps.title: Lab infra
steps.description: Lab infra description. IP-s, user names etc.

steps.title: Rules
steps.description:
What the student needs to account for. For example SSH is used for checks and not for attacks.
How many times can you enter a wrong answer for an objective etc.

steps.title: Install Suricata
steps.description:
apt-get update && apt-get install suricata

Checks:
```bash
dpkg -l | grep suricata
```

steps.title: Configure Suricata
steps.description:
Configure parameters in /etc/suricata/suricata.yaml
Make sure Suricata is running.

Checks:
  ```bash
  if [ $(systemctl status suricata) -eq 0] && [ $(grep -i 'engine started' /var/log/suricata/suricata.log) -eq 0 ] && [ $(ps auxf | grep '[s]uricata') -eq 0 ]
  then
      echo "Success"
  fi
  ```

objectives.title: My first rule
objectives.description: Writing rules for suricata. Types of rules. Structure of a rule etc.

steps.title: Write rule
steps.description:
Create rule to alert on any ICMP traffic.

Checks:
```bash
ls /etc/suricata/rules/custom.rules
```

steps.title: Test rule
steps.description:
Add rule to suricata configs. Make sure rule fires and alert is logged.

- Checks:
  - Alerts for the right criteria appear.
  ```bash
  # TODO: Grep criteria probably needs refinement/Also check that right attacking ip is logged
  if [ $(grep -i 'icmp' /var/log/suricata/fast.log) -eq 0 ]
  then
      echo "Success"
  fi
  ```

objectives.title: IPS Mode
objectives.description: How to run Suricata in IPS mode aka ability to block traffic based on signatures

steps.title: Run in IPS mode
steps.description:
Reconfigure Suricata to run inline IPS

Checks:
```bash
# NFQueue support
suricata --build-info | grep NFQueue | awk '{print $3}'
# running with q option
ps auxf | grep 'suricata' | grep '-q'
# IPTables
sudo iptables -vnL | grep 'NFQUEUE'
```

steps.title: Drop rule
steps.description:
Convert previous ICMP alert rule to drop rule.

- Checks:
  - Traffic does not reach web server/PING reply does not succeed, but web request works.
  ```bash
  if [ $(ping -c 1 1.2.3.4) -ne 0 ] && [ $(curl -m 3 http://1.2.3.4) -eq 0 ]
  then
      echo "Success"
  fi
  ```
